posts.name: Emily
posts.cooked: We ran our autonomus path on the training ground a couple of times in a row and it worked perfectly fine, same as in a couple of our matches. But in a couple of other matches the robot didn’t do what he needed to. Didn’t come to the points, paused and continued, turned, didn’t turn on systems… Before every match we did restart robot code and haven’t changed anything in our autonomus code through the competition. Someone had this problem? Knows what could it be?

posts.name: mjbergman92
posts.cooked: Without code, it would be difficult to answer. There are too many possible causes to rule out that code or some logging from your code is necessary.
Are you using April tags? Also, was your auton running on the same side (blue or red) as on the practice field?

posts.name: mjbergman92
posts.cooked: That was my first thought, some call to DriverStation.getAlliance() that is called too early, but I didn’t want to suggest much and waste anyones time without seeing code.

posts.name: Emily
posts.cooked: we don’t use limelight only odometry by jyro and CANcoders, the problem is on both blue and red sides… Sorry we cannot apload the code from this user, we will apload from another

posts.name: gadyh
posts.cooked:
4_notes_auto.py (10.6 KB) here is the auto path

Holonomic_follower.py (1.6 KB) traj_gen.py (4.0 KB) these are the trajectory generator and the hollonomic follower

posts.name: Scarlett Saam
posts.cooked: We previously had issues with our auton whenever it was put onto the red alliance, are you experiencing something similar? Does it act goofy specifically when set up on one side of the field? My team found a solution to that, which I can go find if it’s the case for your team as well

posts.name: Emily
posts.cooked: No, it happens on both sides:,)

posts.name: Scarlett Saam
posts.cooked: Could it be a battery issue?
